page.title: 15Shopping
page.content: As there ae only two shops in Crayke most people travel further afield to make their purchases. Most of the people who visit a market go to the nearest one at Easingwold on a Friday. Other markets visited in order of preference are York, Thirsk, Northallerton, Ripon, Leeds and Boroughbridge. People who prefer to shop at large supermarkets lchoose to go to York, Boroughbridge or Thirsk. People shopping for clothes preferred York or Leeds to the smaller towns. Crayke shops are used mainly for food in small quantites and post office but Easingwold is used for lothes, shoes, meat, DIY, hardware, haberdashery, cakes, fruit, and vegetables., wine and newspapers. There is a delivery of newspapers and milk There is a mobile for library, meat and vegetables.
